On Fri, 2005-05-06 at 19:51, stack wrote:
> I'll close the polls on the 'move unit tests' proposal.  Here's the 
> final tally:
> 
> In favor of moving unit tests:
>        
>     3 votes (Christian, Tom Emerson, and Kris).
> 
> Against moving unit tests:
>    
>     3 votes (Igor, Gordon, and John Erik and bergmark_d w/ 0.5 votes each).
> 
> Since there is no clear majority, lets leave the tests where they are 
> for now.
> 
> Consensus seems to have it that we revisit this decision when src tree 
> has more unit test classes that we currently have (We're coming up on 
> ~20%, as Christian has stated).  Lets revisit when unit test classes are 
> above 30% or just before a scheduled spate of rabid unit test class 
> additions.

For the record, at least some IDEs allow you to jump back and forth
between tested class and test class.  IntelliJ has a plugin that allows
that.  In our project, unit tests are in their own directory, but then
we've been strict with having unit tests right from the start.

-Lars
